page.title: 12SAXON STREET METHODIST CH.
page.content: There is a {Methodist Chapel}in Saxon Street, which is quite big in comparison to the size of other methodist chapels in our area. The chapel has a high ceiling and low lights hung on chains. You can hear someone whispering from the back. To build the chapel, local people had to raise money to buy the materials. Saxon Street Chapel is more plain than St Mary's CofE Church in Cheveley, which is decorated with stained glass windows and has a piped organ. The chapel has plainer coloured windows and an electronic organ. We talked to Mrs Jaggard, one of the local preachers at the church. She is also the Captain of the Girls' Brigade there. At chapel she sometimes plays the organ. She said that Methodists don't have bishops, which the CofE have.
